answers.answer: Hello and hope you are doing well.The reports indicate that both the ECG and ECHO are within normal limits. Normal sinus rhythm (NSR) is the characteristic rhythm of the healthy human heart. The normal regular rhythm of the heart set by the natural pacemaker of the heart called the sinoatrial (or sinus) node, hence the sinus rhythm.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.

Thanks....question....I am also diagnosed to neuropatic pain...coz im experiencing pins & neddles,tingling on my legs arms ang going to my neck to my head....so ive done a lot of blood test ultra sound on my neck & doppler scan on my head even mri/mra the results was still negative.....i am also tacking maintebnace for my hypertension, and i had also a muscle spasm on my cervical & lumbar area......still sometimes im experiencing the pins & needles on my neck & head......is this in relation on my cervical & lumbar muscle spasm? sometimes if im over fatigue or worke tjis feeling occurs.thanks

Hello and hope you are doing well.Understand your predicament. The symptom described by you could be due to neuropathy. It is a disorder of the nerves which causes numbness, tingling, unusual sensations and sometimes pain. Diabetes Mellitus can cause neuropathy. Other causes like vitamin deficiencies, alcohol consumption and certain medications can cause neuropathy. Please discuss this with your doctor am sure he will provide further assistance. He may ask for blood tests to detect the cause.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.

hi. i have my ECG and 2D echo done. actually i got my ECG first, and diagnosis was sinus tachycardia. so the cardiologist told me to have 2D ECHO. during my 2D ECHO no other diagnosis was made except sinus tachycardia. she said nothing is unusual except my heart beats fast. what could it mean?

Hello and hope you are doing well.Heart can increase due to exercise, fear or anxiety normally. Sinus tachycardia or increased heart rate can occur with anemia, anxiety, hyperthyroidism, fever and dehydration. It may sometimes be due to a cardiac disorder like arrhythmias (altered electrical system of the heart).Hope this helped and do keep us posted.

title: 2d Result
